questions.question: Find the greatest number that will divide 43, 91 and 183 so as to leave the same remainder in each case.
The H.C.F. of two numbers is 23 and the other two factors of their L.C.M. are 13 and 14. The larger of the two numbers is:
Six bells commence tolling together and toll at intervals of 2, 4, 6, 8 10 and 12 seconds respectively. In 30 minutes, how many times do they toll together?
Let N be the greatest number that will divide 1305, 4665 and 6905, leaving the same remainder in each case. Then sum of the digits in N is:
The greatest number of four digits which is divisible by 15, 25, 40 and 75 is:
The product of two numbers is 4107. If the H.C.F. of these numbers is 37, then the greater number is:
Three numbers are in the ratio of 3 : 4 : 5 and their L.C.M. is 2400. Their H.C.F. is:
The G.C.D. of 1.08, 0.36 and 0.9 is:
The product of two numbers is 2028 and their H.C.F. is 13. The number of such pairs is:
The least multiple of 7, which leaves a remainder of 4, when divided by 6, 9, 15 and 18 is:
Find the lowest common multiple of 24, 36 and 40.
The least number which should be added to 2497 so that the sum is exactly divisible by 5, 6, 4 and 3 is:
Reduce 128352 to its lowest terms.
The least number which when divided by 5, 6, 7 and 8 leaves a remainder 3, but when divided by 9 leaves no remainder, is:

A, B and C start at the same time in the same direction to run around a circular stadium. A completes a round in 252 seconds, B in 308 seconds and C in 198 seconds, all starting at the same point. After what time will they again meet at the starting point?
The H.C.F. of two numbers is 11 and their L.C.M. is 7700. If one of the numbers is 275, then the other is:
What will be the least number which when doubled will be exactly divisible by 12, 18, 21 and 30?
The ratio of two numbers is 3 : 4 and their H.C.F. is 4. Their L.C.M. is:
The smallest number which when diminished by 7, is divisible by 12, 16, 18, 21 and 28 is:
252 can be expressed as a product of primes as:
